message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

This paper proposes a method for segmenting an unordered text document, which is a common task in natural language processing. The paper uses both statistical and predictive methods, which are commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper also tests its approach on Wikipedia documents, which are often used in information retrieval and text processing research. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.LG (Machine Learning), which are all related to natural language processing and information retrieval. Additionally, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DL (Deep Learning) are also likely sub-categories, as they are both related to machine learning and predictive methods.
